Class ContentMessage

  • java.lang.Object

extends MV2Message

    Marcel Singer

      • getSender

        public java.security.cert.X509Certificate getSender()
                                             throws java.security.cert.CertificateException,
                                                    java.io.IOException
        Returns the senders certificate.
        Returns:
        The certificate of the sending instance. To get the address of the sender see the common name (CN) of the certificate.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
        java.security.cert.CertificateException - If the certificate can not be obtained from its encoding.

      • sign

        public void sign(SignatureProvider signatureProvider,
                 java.security.PrivateKey key)
          throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                 java.io.IOException,
                 java.security.SignatureException
        Signs this message.

        Remarks: This must be done after all other fields have been set. Otherwise the signature will be invalid.

        Parameters:
        signatureProvider - The provider to use.
        key - The private key of the signing instance.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - Is thrown if the given key is invalid.
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
        java.security.SignatureException - If the signature object is not initialized properly.

      • sign

        public void sign(java.security.PrivateKey key)
          throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                 java.io.IOException,
                 java.security.SignatureException
        Signs this message.

        Remarks: This must be done after all other fields have been set. Otherwise the signature will be invalid.

        Parameters:
        key - The private key of the signing instance.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - Is thrown if the given key is invalid.
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
        java.security.SignatureException - If the signature object is not initialized properly.

      • verifySignature

        public boolean verifySignature(SignatureProvider signatureProvider,
                               java.security.PublicKey key)
                        throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                               java.io.IOException,
                               java.security.SignatureException
        Verifies the signature of this message.
        Parameters:
        signatureProvider - The SignatureProvider to use.
        key - The public key of the signing instance.
        Returns:
        true if the signature is valid.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - If the supplied public key is invalid.
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
        java.security.SignatureException - If the signature object is not initialized properly.

      • verifySignature

        public boolean verifySignature(SignatureProvider signatureProvider)
                        throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                               java.security.SignatureException,
                               java.security.cert.CertificateException,
                               java.io.IOException
        Verifies the signature of this message with the public key obtained from the senders certificate.
        Parameters:
        signatureProvider - The SignatureProvider to use.
        Returns:
        true if the signature is valid.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - Is thrown if the key from the issuers certificate is invalid.
        java.security.SignatureException - If an the signature object is not initialized properly.
        java.security.cert.CertificateException - Is thrown if the certificate can no be decoded.
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

      • verifySignature

        public boolean verifySignature()
                        throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                               java.security.SignatureException,
                               java.security.cert.CertificateException,
                               java.io.IOException
        Verifies the signature (SHA256 with RSA) of this message with the public key obtained from the senders certificate.
        Returns:
        true if the signature is valid.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - Is thrown if the key from the issuers certificate is invalid.
        java.security.SignatureException - If an the signature object is not initialized properly.
        java.security.cert.CertificateException - Is thrown if the certificate can no be decoded.
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
